reviewText: Blood Rage, shown as Nightmare At Shadow Woods (1987) is quite well made considering it's low budget roots, although the music was quite good.I had completely forgotten this movie until I saw it at the local video store. I first saw this at the movie theater around Halloween 1987, and it was shown as "Nightmare At Shadow Woods."I guess the film company wanted to bring it back under a new name to cash in better than its original release. Great gore scenes inserted between some pretty horrifying acting. A weak plot can destroy a movie, but for horror flicks it doesn't matter now does it?Criticize it for what you will, but Blood Rage is one of the better 'lost' horror flicks of its day. It's 80's horror that takes a refreshing break from the slasher film conventions.Recommended for those who favor more gore over suspense.

reviewText: A mum named Maddy (Louise Lasser! Louise Lasser!) takes her twin 10yo sons, Terry and Todd, to the drive-in theater for a night of wholesome, movie-watching fun. Unfortunately, Terry is a homicidal maniac who can't resist slipping out of the car in order to butcher someone w/ an axe! To make matters worse, Terry blames his brother for the murder, causing him to be locked up in a mental institution. Now, ten years later, Todd has escaped, and is heading for home. It's Thanksgiving, so Maddy tries to enjoy the holiday anyway. Astoundingly, her plans are dashed. Can Todd's doctor track him down and tranquilize him before he kills again? Any guesses? BLOOD RAGE is another hackneyed, yet loveable Slasher from the mid / late 80s. Soooo, it's packed w/ squirty, gooshy gore FX, big-big hair, and a lunk-headed synthesizer score! A perfect slice of pointless, bubble-brained cheddar from this silly decade! Still, my favorite scene involves Ms. Lasser sitting on the kitchen floor, devouring leftovers! She's so upset by the whole ordeal that she begins cleaning the oven vigorously! Drop whatever you're doing, and watch this now! NOW!...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Made in 1983, and released in a cut form under Nightmare At Shadow Woods in 1987. Blood Rage is a sadly obscure slasher film which doesn't get the attention it deserves. Only released on dvd in a terribly cut form under Nigtmare At Shadow Woods, Blood Rage tells the story of two twin brothers Todd and Terry. When they were children, Terry commited a violent murder at the local drive in and blamed it on his brother Todd. Years later family and friends get together for Thanksgiving when they find out that Todd has escaped from the mental hospital! Soon enough bodies begin to pile up. Will anybody survive Thanksgiving?Blood Rage is quite the impressive film, there's so much here that really makes it stand out among the crowd, and yet it seems almost nobody realizes it exists. The gore for example in the uncut version is extremely high and the effects are all done incredibly well. Hands cut off, bodies split in two etc. It's honestly one the more gory slasher films of the 80's that didn't have Tom Savini involved, and it's sure to please horror fans who like their slashers with alot of splatter. Now after the films terrific opening it does get rather shaky for about 20 minutes. The acting seemed incredibly weak, and it seemed somewhat thrown together. Stay with it though, cause after about 30 minutes everything clicks and comes together extremely well. The acting, the pacing, the suspense, the directing, and the cast improved greatly. Mark Soper plays both Terry and Todd, and I was impressed at how well he played both characters, he was able to give both characters completely different personalities, and you really do forget it's one actor playing 2 roles. Everyone else in the film does a good job, and there's a only moment or two of overacting. Another thing that really works here is it's setting. The film takes place at an apartment complex, and you very rarely ever see the setting in an 80's slasher movie. The setting is used fully too. We get scenes in different apartments, the pool area, the tennis court etc. So not only is the setting somewhat different, but the filmmakers also thankfully used it to it's full extent. It really adds to the movie.Finally the film ends on quite the dark, depressing, and sad note. Some people may not love the ending, but I thought it was effective, and done extremely well.The films rated R, and the uncut version has plenty of gore, a couple sex scenes and some nudity.Overall Blood Rage is a great movie. It really deserves a proper release uncut on DVD or Blu Ray, and I think it would gain a much bigger fanbase if it got one.Definitly worth seeing.

reviewText: This is a great 80s slasher film with extremely gory kills and lots of feel-good 80s teen horror schlock. There's a new wave synth pop soundtrack, pre-marital sex, drugs, and ridiculous dialog. I laughed out loud. The pacing is decent and kept me entertained. It deserves a DVD release! Watch for Ted Raimi selling condoms near the start of the film.

reviewText: I agree with all of the comments totally.  Now, if anyone can find the DVD on the Legacy label.  Very rare, and from what I hear, excellent quality.  Also, no one mentioned that Louise Lasser (Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman.)is in the cast.  For trivia, her character's name is also Lasser.
summary: Bloodrage, aka Nightmare at Shadow Ridge

reviewText: This is a classic 80's slasher film, and has enough splatter to satisfy any splatter fan. The story isn't that bad, there a lot of killing in the beginning of the film. The middle of the film is a little boring but when the killing picks up again, it makes the film worth watching. I added this little gem to my horror collection. It has naked girls,gore,impailments,decapitations, and lots of blood. That makes a good horror movie in my opinion.
